result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Markola I. WILLIAMS

State moves to dismiss and read in.  The defendant plead to charges of bail jumping and strangution/suffocation in 14 CF 483.  Motion granted.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 03-07-14 at 1:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.
Steven Alpert,  through public defender.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Initial Appearance on 02-10-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
Copy filed.
RE:  Bail jumping, on 01-23-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 3 counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-10-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he maintain absolute sobriety and must have no contact with any licensed premises which serve alcohol.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
